page.title: 17Fronlas Nature Trail
page.content: On the College farm there is a nature trail.It is circular and starts and ends at the farm.Yellow arrows show the right of way and black ones the trail.Leaflets are provided. Part of the trail runs through cwm Fronlas, strip of woodland dingle.In the cwm is a surprising collection of plants and animals.Stinging nettles grow everywhere and provide food for butterflies,like the Red {Admiral,Speckled Wood and Meadow {Brown. Wild flowers include {buttercups,foxglove and yellow {pimpernel.Birds abound;blue {tits,chaffinches and pied fly {catchers. The trail shows how farming and wildlife-care can be combined.
